intro: Englerina kapiriensis, commonly known as the Kapiriensis Englerina, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
